qas.question: Where did the first debate, between Kerry and Bush take place?
Who was considered to have been the winner of the debate?
Who was the moderator of the first debate between Kerry and Bush?
What was thought to be the main focal point of the debate?
How did the opinion regarding Kerry change, after being delared the winner of the debate?

answers.text: strengthening what had come to be seen as a weak and troubled campaign

qas.question: Where did the first debate between Lehrer and Kerry take place?

plausible_answers.text: gain international support for the 2003 Invasion of Iraq

qas.question: What did Lehrer accuse Kerry of not doing in 2003?
What was Lehrer's reply to Kerry in the debate?
What was the deciding opinion about Lehrer's performance in the debate?

plausible_answers.text: numerous scowls and negative facial expressions

qas.question: What did the media air to show Lehrer's annoyance with Kerry?

context: The first debate was held on September 30 at the <a0_0><b5_0>University of Miami<b5_0/><a0_0/>, moderated by <a2_0>Jim Lehrer<a2_0/> of PBS. During the debate, slated to focus on <a3_0>foreign policy<a3_0/>, Kerry accused Bush of having failed to <b6_0>gain international support for the 2003 Invasion of Iraq<b6_0/>, saying the only countries assisting the U.S. during the invasion were the United Kingdom and Australia. Bush replied to this by saying, <b7_0>"Well, actually, he forgot Poland."<b7_0/> Later, a consensus formed among mainstream pollsters and pundits that <a1_0>Kerry<a1_0/> <b8_0>won the debate decisively<b8_0/>, <a4_0>strengthening what had come to be seen as a weak and troubled campaign<a4_0/>. In the days after, coverage focused on Bush's apparent annoyance with Kerry and <b9_0>numerous scowls and negative facial expressions<b9_0/>.
